indicator_name: Number of victims of intentional homicide per 100,000 population, by sex and age
target_name: Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere

source_url_text_1: T91 Total victims by age and sex
source_url_text_1c: T91 Risk of victimization – Total offenses, completed, attempts (only available in German)
source_organisation_2: Federal Statistical Office (Destatis)
source_url_text_2b: Population data based on Census 2011 and on Census 2022 (only available in German)

footer_fields.label: Notes
footer_fields.value:
• Victims recorded in the reporting year may also originate from an earlier year (initial statistics).
• For 2010, the population was calculated retrospectively on the basis of the 2011 census and migration, birth, and death statistics. For 2012 to 2021, the retrospective calculation was performed in the same way, but on the basis of the 2022 census.

footer_fields.label: Notes
footer_fields.value:
• Number of victims per 100,000 inhabitants (V/100,000) based on the population on December 31 of the previous year.
• Victims recorded in the reporting year may also originate from an earlier year (initial statistics).
• From 2013 onwards, the population is based on the 2011 census, and from 2024 onwards on the 2022 census.

footer_fields.label: Note
footer_fields.value: Victims recorded in the reporting year may also originate from an earlier year (initial statistics).
